summary:
The Buddha, born Siddhartha Gautama, was a religious teacher who lived in ancient South Asia. He left his royal life to become a wandering ascetic, seeking enlightenment. After meditating and teaching, he founded Buddhism.

Buddha's main ideas include the Four Noble Truths and the Noble Eightfold Path, guiding people to end suffering. He taught a balanced life, avoiding extremes. His teachings spread, and he is known as the "Awakened One." Buddhism grew, with many texts and traditions, and his influence is seen in art and other religions like Hinduism.
title: The Buddha
